Description: Rim and body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery Siana cup; interior glazed black; exterior: on rim, part of floral motif (tip of pendant bud remaining); below junction with handle zone, black band; below, in hamdle zone, bridled horse's head and part of neck to left; added red on neck; on the right, upright spear carried by lost rider. .
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
There are strong similarities between the horse on this sherd and one in Reading 14.9.84.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 375, no. B516)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0367) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
